Probabilistic & Quantum System Verificat.description: I joined the research group #h{https://group-mmm.org/eratommsd/}{ERATO-MMSD} as a Ph.D. student in October, 2024. It is known that a wide range of technique in the probabilistic model checking can be modified and translated into the quantum setting, but it is currently lacking a general framework for guiding such translation. Hence the goal of the project is to develop a categorical framework that unifies the approach for formulating and verifying various models in the probabilistic and quantum setting, in the same time we also looking for opportunities to develop algorithms and tools for quantum model checking based on the theorem developed.

Reactive Synthesis & Automata Learning.description: I visited professor #h{https://verif.ulb.ac.be/jfr/}{Jean-Fran√ßois Raskin} in the Summer of 2023, we had a project that studied the problems of #h{https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-30820-8_20}{example-guided reactive synthesis}, we looked into the extension with involving a stochastic environmental input and attempt to formulate a way to generate a set of optimal realizable examples of system trace with respect to a certain cost/reward function. The project is still in progress.

Parameterized Algorithm & Model Checking.description: I joined the research group #h{https://amir.goharshady.com/alpacas-research-group}{ALPACAS} lead by professor #h{https://amir.goharshady.com/home}{Amir Goharshady} in 2021, the group focuses on a broad area of theoretical computer science, ranging from parameterized algorithm, formal methods to cryptography and blockchains. I mainly worked in the field of formal methods and model checking but also kept an eyes on the application of parameterized algorithm for improving the solutions. Our #h{https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3622868}{recent work} improved the existing algebraic program analysis (APA) framework and provided an efficient extension to the on-demand setting.

Computational Fluid Dynamics & Dynamical.description: The project is conducted under the supervision of professor #h{https://mathematicsasaprofession.my.canva.site/}{Shingyu Leung}, the project aims to develop efficient methods for visualizing the Lagrangian Coherent Structure under different settings, with a particular focus on the Lagrangian Coherent Structure (LCS). Various approaches like Finite-time Lyapunov Exponent (FTLE), clustering methods, and trajectory analysis have been studied and we proposed a new quantity for capturing LCS in a recent paper submitted to CiCP. Recently we are looking into the stochastic extension of our proposed framework and working around both the optimization of the method and analysis on different test cases.

STMC coding team instructor.description: I part-time worked as a coding team instructor at #h{https://www.stmc.edu.hk}{Shatin Methodist College (STMC)}, I am in charge of tutoring a class of form one (equivalently grade 7) students to provide them the basic coding skills in Python as well as some foundations in logics, mathematics and algorithms. Some of the past teaching material can be found #h{https://www.stmc.edu.hk/codingteam/}{here}.
